title: C++ Data Structures & Algorithms Roadmap
description: A dedicated roadmap covering data structures, algorithms, and complexity analysis in modern C++.

modules.title: Module 1: Foundations of Data Structures & Algorithms
modules.description: Establish fundamental terminology, problem-solving strategies, and the role of algorithm analysis in C++.

lessons.title: Lesson 1.1: Why Data Structures & Algorithms Matter
Lesson 1.2: Building Simple Algorithms in C++
Lesson 1.3: Core Data Structures and Memory Semantics

modules.title: Module 2: Arrays, Searching & Foundational Sorting
modules.description: Investigate contiguous storage patterns, baseline searching strategies, and the evolution from naive to instrumented sorting in modern C++.

lessons.title: Lesson 2.1: Arrays, Search Patterns, and Instrumented Sorting

modules.title: Module 3: Linked Lists & Dynamic Memory Management
modules.description: Explore node-based structures, pointer semantics, and memory allocation patterns for flexible data storage in C++.

lessons.title: Lesson 3.1: Linked Lists, Memory Management, and Operations

modules.title: Module 4: Stacks & Queues - LIFO and FIFO Data Structures
modules.description: Master Last-In-First-Out (LIFO) and First-In-First-Out (FIFO) patterns with efficient implementations in modern C++.

lessons.title: Lesson 4.1: Stacks, Queues, and Their C++ Implementations

modules.title: Module 5: Hash Tables & Hash-based Data Structures
modules.description: Master key-value mapping with hash functions, collision resolution, and efficient lookup operations in modern C++.

lessons.title: Lesson 5.1: Hash Tables, Hash Functions, and Collision Resolution

prerequisites: Comfortable with compiling and running basic C++ programs
Familiarity with standard library headers and namespaces
Ability to use a debugger or logging statements to inspect program state
outcomes: Explain the relationship between data structures, algorithms, and performance
Trace the execution of simple algorithms and reason about their complexity
Use baseline analytical tools to classify runtime growth in C++ programs
